result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Scott Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Joint and several.  
Already paid by co-defendant in 15CF90.
Need not be paid from prison monies.

Payable out of 25% of prison monies.
Work out payment plan with agent.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 4-14-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with Walmart stores.
No contact with co-defendants, P.S. or A.S.

Follow through with AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare, continuation of accepted aftercare treatment upon release to extended supervison.
Enroll into and successfully complete Cognitive/Behavioral Programming.
